thread.title: Police gun fight leaves two officers dead, one survives with injuries - Nairobi News
thread.title_full: Police gun fight leaves two officers dead, one survives with injuries - Nairobi News

title: Police gun fight leaves two officers dead, one survives with injuries - Nairobi News
text:
Police gun fight leaves two officers dead, one survives with injuries Posted on Feb 22, 2017 14832 Views By FRED MUKINDA 
Two police officers died while another was injured after they fought among themselves at a Nairobi estate. 
During the fight, one of the officers attached to Embakasi police station shot dead his colleague then turned the gun on himself. 
The other officer survived with bullet injuries and was admitted to hospital. 
The survivor is based at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport police station while the other officer worked at Jogoo House, national police headquarters 
The midnight incident happened at Tasia estate Wednesday. 
BULLET WOUND 
“A report of shooting was made by a member of the public officers on patrol duties that there was a police officer who was shot and was being treated at Bliss hospital. The duty officer visited the hospital and found the injured colleague had a bullet wound on the right shoulder,” the preliminary police report said. 
At the hospital, the injured officer said he had run away from the scene where he left his two colleagues embroiled in a physical struggle. 
A police Corporal who visited the scene reported to his seniors that he found the officers dead and also recovered a pistol loaded with six rounds of ammunition. 
Four spent cartridges were also found at the scene. The firearm had been issued to one of the officers earlier in the day. 
“Scene was processed by scenes of crime personnel and the bodies moved to Kenyatta university mortuary. The wounded officer was transferred to Nairobi West Hospital in stable condition,” according to a police report. Latest Stories
